name: calcom-mcp
description: MCP server for interacting with the Cal.com API â€” manage bookings, event types, schedules, teams, users, and webhooks.
long_description: A local MCP server that connects to the Cal.com API v2, enabling LLMs to manage your Cal.com scheduling data. Supports listing event types, creating and filtering bookings, viewing schedules, teams, users, and webhooks. Requires a Cal.com API v2 key.

api_key.title: Cal.com API Key
api_key.description: Your Cal.com API v2 key. Get it from Cal.com Settings > Developer > API Keys.

tools.name: get_api_status
tools.description: Check if the Cal.com API key is configured in the environment

tools.name: list_event_types
tools.description: Fetch a list of active (non-hidden) event types from Cal.com with simplified details

tools.name: get_bookings
tools.description: Fetch bookings from Cal.com with optional filters (event type, user, status, date range)

tools.name: create_booking
tools.description: Create a new booking in Cal.com for a specific event type and attendee

tools.name: list_schedules
tools.description: List all schedules available to the authenticated user or for a specific user/team

tools.name: list_teams
tools.description: List all teams available to the authenticated user

tools.name: list_users
tools.description: List all users available to the authenticated account

tools.name: list_webhooks
tools.description: List all webhooks configured for the authenticated account

tools.name: get_my_profile
tools.description: Get the profile of the currently authenticated Cal.com user

tools.name: update_my_profile
tools.description: Update the profile of the currently authenticated Cal.com user (name, email, timezone, bio, etc.)

tools.name: get_schedule
tools.description: Get a specific schedule by ID with availability and overrides

tools.name: update_schedule
tools.description: Update an existing schedule's name, timezone, availability blocks, or date overrides
